intro: Licaria leonis, commonly known as the lion's licaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
